whoAreWe.title: Who are we?
whoAreWe.p1: Classrooms for Change Ghana is a charity and volontair organization. It’s founded by me, Hadla. Let me introduce myself and tell you why I started this orgnaization!
whoAreWe.p2: My name is Hadla Bergman. I’m a Software Engineer from Sweden. I’ve traveled between Sweden and Ghana for 5 years to help organize schools in villages. Ghana’s government sponser schools all over the contry to offer free education. Schools in villages unfortunatly lack this funding. Their not given a fair chance. That is why you and me are going to bring the education closer to them.
whoAreWe.p3: Let’s make the world a little more fair, together!
whoAreWe.longTerm.title: What is out long-term vision?
whoAreWe.longTerm.text: To give children a chance for a better future, by helping them develop skills and competence necessary to help them out of poverty. Hence, the most important mission is to build a school that receives continuous support in order to succeed in creating lasting improvement.
whoAreWe.mission.title: What is our mission?
whoAreWe.mission.text:
We want to give children a more secure and stable future by helping them develop the skills and competence necessary to help them out of poverty.

Help us endance the education rate in villages secluded from these opportunities.
whoAreWe.succeed.title: How will we succeed with our mission?
whoAreWe.succeed.text: To be able to make a real change, we need to provide continuous support for years and years to come. We have people both in Sweden and in Ghana to make sure the project is always moving forward.
